document.ModsDocTitle: Streamlining the use of BOLD specimen data to record species distributions: a case study with ten Nearctic species of Microgastrinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: This species is relatively widely distributed in northeast North America, extending up to central Canada ( Yu et al. 2012 ). It was recorded from five provinces in Canada (MB, NB, NS, ON, QC) by Fernandez-Triana (2010) , but no locality records were provided at the time. Here we present additional information about the distribution of the species in Canada, including one new provincial record (PE), based on examined specimens from the BIO and CNC collections. Data for those specimens was extracted from BOLD.
